channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Lacson on overpricing: Let the records speak
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Panfilo Lacson does not buy the claim that no overpricing or anomaly stained the government’s procurement of medical supplies from Pharmally Pharmaceutical Corp., saying “the record will speak for itself.”

item.title: Philippines can’t secure enough Tocilizumab – Galvez
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Philippines is encountering difficulties in securing enough supply of Tocilizumab, a drug administered to COVID-19 patients, a Palace official said yesterday.

item.title: NCR COVID-19 cases may peak in 2 weeks – OCTA
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: A member of OCTA Research yesterday said cases in Metro Manila may peak in the next couple of weeks.

item.title: China bolstering presence in South China Sea — US think tank
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: China’s deployment of radar, anti-ship and anti-air missile platforms, and combat aircraft to outposts in the South China Sea has greatly expanded its ability to project power in waters far from its coast, according to a US think tank.

item.title: No budget next year for ‘Libreng Sakay’
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The government’s “Libreng Sakay” and service contracting program for public utility vehicles that benefited over three million passengers during the pandemic may be discontinued next year.

item.title: Pateros to place yellow ribbons on houses with COVID-19 cases
item.author: Ghio Ong
item.description: Yellow ribbons will be used to tag households in Pateros confirmed to have COVID-19 patients and placed under localized lockdown, the town’s mayor said.

item.title: ECOP wants free testing, hospital reimbursement
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: While businesses welcome the shift to Alert Level 4 in Metro Manila, the government needs to do more to improve the health care system to allow the economy to reopen safely, according to the Employers Confederation of the Philippines.

item.title: Vapers: Smokers want better alternative to cigarettes
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Nine of 10 Filipino smokers want a law that would encourage them to switch to less harmful alternatives to cigarettes, a survey commissioned by consumer advocacy group Vapers PH showed.

item.title: BIR to probe 250 social media influencers
item.author: Elijah Felice Rosales
item.description: At least 250 social media influencers are up for investigation for nonpayment of taxes and other violations of the tax code, the Bureau of Internal Revenue revealed yesterday.

item.title: Airlines seek greater mobility for vaccinated – Concepcion
item.description: Operating airlines have asked the help of presidential adviser for entrepreneurship Joey Concepcion to push for greater mobility among the vaccinated in the transport sector to allow the industry to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.
